column4: Hello. When I copy files from/to a pmounted usb media I get no progres information. The file seems to be written immediately and I never know when it's finished and if I can pumount it. Any idea what could be the problem here?
I think pmount uses async, which means it just tells the computer to write to the drive later
which I personally think is stupid.
I tried it several times. It finally works when rw access is over but I always have to wait and try (and try again) ...
I suggest you create an fstab entry for it

What is the advantage of creating an fstab entry for the usb device? This is the current line from mtab: "/dev/sdb1 /media/PHONE vfat rw,noexec,nosuid,nodev,noatime,uid=1000,utf8,shortname=lower 0 0". Anything here to improve with a separate entry?
mtab just shows what partitions are mounted
afterwards, to mount it, do mount /media/PHONE
Adding "sync" to the pmount options also solved the problem. Thank you.
I find the async used is incredibly annoying for media you remove a lot
Yes, and 2m39.332s for a 6.5MB file sounds a little more realistic :/
